Summary: Light high in sky, appeared at first with brigher star with a fan tail, then faded.
divs: sighting detailsat 6:45 pm, 7 of our family members witnessed a "star" in the sky that had a fan tail that looked like "vapor" that was not as bright. the star and fan was directly above and to the western sky. it moved in the directon of the "point" of the fan (west) then changed more of a nnw direction. as it moved, the star disappeared, but the lit vapor continued to glow, but the "fan shape" became more shapeless, just a glow. the glowing area moved pretty quickly across the sky in about 2 minutes to the nnw location and remained still. throughout the event, there were flashes of light emitting from the glowing area. gradually the glowing area faded, but was still visible. we had to leave, so we assume that the area continued to fade. we called our local news and we heard 2 others had also called. see link to see explaination: http:\\www.wspa.com\midatlantic\spa\news.apx.-content-articles-spa-2007-12-10-0015.html
trends: There have been 22 other sightings in Columbia
There were no other sightings in Columbia on or around December 10th 2007
